intro: Sida rojasii, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, pink to purple flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida rojasii is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
